name.str: On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural and Supernatural Selection
name.str_pl: copies of On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural and Supernatural Selection

description: This is a mass-market paperback copy of Charles Darwin's famous book where he laid out his theory of evolution and the way that magic influences the course of speciation.  The book was extremely controversial when it came out for positing a recent common ancestor for humans and dwarves and for claiming that elves as a distinct species only date back to 3 million years before present.
//: Extra chapters to account for talking about magic

name.str: Running on Empty: A Social History of those Born Without Magic
name.str_pl: copies of Running on Empty: A Social History of those Born Without Magic

description: A history of the treatment of the "Empty", people born with the inability to master even the simplest of spells.  From persecution to favored positions (since rulers could be sure the Empty had no magical means of plotting against them), this book chronicles their treatment across the ages.

name.str: Prisons and Magic: The History of Past and Present Antimagic Restraints
name.str_pl: copies of Prisons and Magic: The History of Past and Present Antimagic Restraints

description: A detailed overview of the means used by ancient societies to keep imprisoned magic users inside prisons.  From the chains and gag to the mana-leech shackle, this book covers the myriad of ways prisons dealt with teleportation, invisibility, intangibility and every other magic that could be used for an evasion.

This annual publication covers the latest advances in bionic technomancy, the implantation of metal into flesh.  There are some pretty promising new developments in here that will now never see the light of day.
